definition: an amplifying (see amplify sense 1) or explanatory word, phrase, or sentence inserted in a passage from which it is usually set off by punctuation
a remark or passage that departs from the theme of a discourse : digression
examples: The speaker inserted some often amusing parentheses during his speech.
The parenthesis of war interrupted the course of his life.

definition: one or both of the curved marks ( ) used in writing and printing to enclose a parenthetical expression or to group a symbolic unit in a logical or mathematical expression
examples: The plant's common name is followed by its Latin name in parentheses.
